intro: Polygonifolia capensis, commonly known as the Cape polygonleaf, is a perennial shrub native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its distinctive, lobed leaves that resemble a polygon shape, hence its scientific name. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. It produces small, yellowish-green flowers that bloom in spring, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Due to its ornamental value and adaptability, it is often cultivated in gardens and landscapes.
